page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT IN TIDWORTH
page.content: The Ministry of Defence is the main employer of people in the Tidworth area. Soldiers form the greater part with civilians employed by the Civil Service as clerks,drivers or cleaners. Civilians also work in the Officers' Messes and in the retail trade,shops, garages,cafes and pubs. Many school leavers find it difficult to get a job and some have to travel to larger towns,Andover or Salisbury,to find employment. A small number of men work on the land for local farmers. A number of service wives work locally and endeavour is always being made to introduce new trade and employment opportunities. A careers service is run at Ordnance House for school leavers and the Army run resettlement courses for officers and soldiers leaving the service. Plans are in hand to attract light industry to Tidworth.
